repo.name: shadowsocks-libev
repo.description: Bug-fix-only libev port of shadowsocks. Future development moved to shadowsocks-rust

readme.summary: Clear introduction and comprehensive installation instructions, but lacks usage examples, configuration guidance, and troubleshooting help.
readme.top_issue: No actual usage examples showing how to configure or use the proxy after installation - just installation steps and a brief mention of editing config.json without explaining what to put in it.

injection_risks.description: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in crypto_derive_key function due to lack of bounds checking on key_len parameter
Use of MD5 hash algorithm, which is considered insecure for cryptographic purposes

critical_findings: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in crypto_derive_key function
Lack of input validation on password and key parameters in crypto_init function
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential buffer overflow vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows good coding practices.

common_complaints: Compilation/build failures (Windows, Ubuntu 24.10, missing PCRE1 on CentOS)
Plugin compatibility problems with IP forwarding for security tools
Cryptographic weakness enabling offline brute-force attacks
sentiment.summary: Critical community health decline: numerous unresolved technical issues spanning years, zero maintainer engagement on recent issues, critical security vulnerability unfixed, and broad platform support gaps indicate active project abandonment.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being relatively recent (Dec 2025)
131 open issues with no recent activity to address them
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no maintenance activity
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing lack of development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date prevents assessment of release cadence
positive_signals: Repository still exists and was last updated within the past month
No indication of explicit project abandonment or deletion
maintenance.summary: shadowsocks-libev appears stale with a month-old commit but zero maintenance activity over the past 6 months, 131 unaddressed open issues, and no recent releases or contributor engagement.

project_metrics.description: Bug-fix-only libev port of shadowsocks. Future development moved to shadowsocks-rust

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is comprehensive and covers various installation methods, but lacks in providing examples and troubleshooting guides.
concerns: Long time since last release (over a year)
Low number of commits and merged PRs in the past six months
Security: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in crypto_derive_key function
Security: Lack of input validation on password and key parameters in crypto_init function
highlights: Recent activity with open issues and PRs
At least one contributor is still active
